description:
Deadly Desserts is a trick-taking card game. If you've never played a trick-taking game before, Deadly Desserts is the perfect game to start with! The game is played in a series of tricks, in which players play one card each. The winner of each trick takes the cards, most of which deal damage. Thus, your objective is to avoid winning tricks! It's a very fun gameplay style because you win by not winning.

If you're familiar with trick-taking games, Deadly Desserts builds off of classics (e.g. Hearts, Euchre, Bridge) and adds exciting gameplay features, such as Gourmayhem Cards to double cards' values or being able to play 2-10 players rather than 3-4.

—description from the designer

As a secret agent, you've been assigned to catch an elusive spy before they get away. Search for clues and find evidence while you track the spy, but watch out for dangerous explosives!

To Catch a Spy is a 1-2 player game of espionage. To set up, place nine location cards in a 3x3 grid, then place discovery cards under each location. Place three file cards near the locations, then place case cards under each file. Place decks for arrow cards and additional discovery cards nearby, along with two agent tool cards. The spy and agent cards start in different locations.

In the solo game, you are the agent and go first, moving to an adjacent location and revealing a discovery card, which could be an item, clue, or bomb; item and clue cards go in hand, while bombs force you to discard. You can use a location's special ability and clues to reveal case cards under files. You might be able to place a tracking bug on the spy.

For the spy's turn, the arrow cards move the spy to an adjacent location, where a new discovery card is placed at random. If the spy moves to your location, discard a card. If you can't discard a card or discover you've discarded an item matching a case card, you lose immediately.

When the discovery deck is empty, the spy attempts to escape. You must have placed a tracking bug on the spy, have the three item cards in hand matching the case cards, and make it to the spy's current location before the spy escapes.

In the two-player game, one player is the spy while the other is the agent. At the start of a round, each player chooses and reveals an arrow card, then the agent takes their turn, followed by the spy. Gameplay takes place as described above, with the spy needing to place all cards in the discovery deck before trying to escape, while the agent needs to collect the three items matching the case, bug the spy, then reach the spy's location.

Awards:

From the 2020 54-Card Game Design Contest.
-Best Solo Game: 1st place!
-Best Overall Game: 2nd place!
-Best 2 Player Game: 2nd place!
-Best Graphic Design: 3rd place!

A weather board game that uses a voice assistant.
Meteoropaths are demanding travelers whose mood changes according to the weather: their goal is to live the ideal holiday by traveling in 7 different locations with the climatic conditions they prefer.
The meteoropaths available for each player are: the tan fanatic (look for places with a temperature of 25-35 degrees Celsius), the ecological backpacker (15-25), the decadent poet (10-20), the yeti (0-10).
Meteoropaths move on the board asking the voice assistant for information on the local weather: if the temperature is ideal for them, they earn a day off. Players are helped by souvenirs and baggage cards that they can conquer during the game.
The meteoropathic who first completes his 7-day vacation wins, also collecting 3 selfies in 3 different continents.

—description from the designer

In Space Lunch, you take alternating turns and collect food cards until only six food cards remain in the grid, or until a player completes three sets of three food cards of the same type.

Each turn is divided into two phases: The beverage phase and the food phase. At the beginning of your turn, during the beverage phase, players can use three beverage cards of the same type to use the corresponding beverage ability.

During the food phase, players must take one food card from the column where the pick token is placed and its corresponding beverage. After performing this action, the player moves the pick token to the next column to the right. If the pick token is placed below the rightmost column, move the pick token to the leftmost column.

The first player to complete three sets of three food cards of the same type wins. If no one does this and only six food cards remain in the grid, the player with the most pairs of cards of the same type wins, considering that a set of three food cards does not count as a pair.

Game includes rules for 4 classical rules of Draughts and the new game NOBODY. Gameplay is on a regular board of Chess/Draught. It`s a huge wooden board and big wooden pieces.
 One player starts on his first two rows filled with 16 playing pieces in one color. The other player has nothing and is called the NOBODY. One player has to move as much pieces as possible to the two rows of the opposite by using moves similar to Draught. In his turn Nobody can do nothing, or move a piece just one square, or make a special three-step-move to catch pieces by using the pawns of the other player.
Player with most pieces off or on the board wins.

—user summary

TOP JOB is a card game where you team up professionals to launch businesses in 5 different industries. Team up a nurse, a surgeon, a cleaner and a manager and you have a hospital! But be careful... other players may try to steal your cards, hire your crew or send you to pay extra taxes!

Gather the best team following the needs of your Business Partner (personal goal card) and once a player has launched 3 businesses, it's time to score! The player with the highest victory points wins.

THE 1st GAME ABOUT BUSINESS
THAT’S ONLY ABOUT PEOPLE

—description from the publisher

To win, you must use a deck of 50 cards and play them strategically to win the 5 crystal shards of the opponent, one for each direct attack, once per turn.

As Guardian of the Veil, your mission is to obliterate your opponent with the help of warriors that come from all the Worlds that coexist on both sides of the Veil ... Do you have what it takes to conquer your enemies? This is Domhan Rhapsodie!

(Text by publisher)

Ohio Valley Skirmish 
is a miniatures table top wargaming rule set for simulating American Civil War combat.

This rule set is usable for armies from a single regiment to multiple corps per side.

—description from the publisher

Sgt. Ligloo: Napoleonic Skirmish Rules

For 20/28 mm

Each player controls one of more group of 7/12 men each.

Scale:
1 mini = 1 man
1 cm = 1 m
1 turn = 1 min

— published in French

The Mochi Mochi Peach Cat Card Game is family boardgame. In the game, the players will playing cards at the same time, the winner is who can grab more game cards.

The rules of the game are very simple and suitable for playing with children.

One set game include 72 cards and 1 rule sheet.

—description from the designer

Camp Out is a family-friendly, camping-themed, card game for ages 8 and over.

Camp Out consists of 84 playing cards. The object of the game is to collect 3 sets of non-identical camping item & activity cards, from the same category, in order to “Camp Out.” The camping items and activities span six categories, which include the campsite itself, food & drink, wildlife, hiking & fishing, things at the beach, and play and relaxation.

As you play Camp Out, Match Cards help your hand, and a set of six ‘game-changer’ cards called “Trail Mix.” Trail Mix cards can help or hinder your game play, depending who plays them, and how and when they are played. For instance, the “Avalanche” Trail Mix card can be used to make all players shift three of their cards to their left, or the player holding the card can choose to not enforce it. With another Trail Mix card called “Cherry Picking,” a player gets to dig into the discard pile for the right card, which will help their hand. With another Trail Mix card, “Leap Frog” makes the players to either side of the one holding the card exchange two cards simultaneously.

The way in which this “pickup & discard” game plays out, includes a playing feature both near the end, and at the end of a round, which gives Camp Out its name. When a player is one turn from possibly going out, they signal the other players by announcing their status with the word “Camp.” They do this not only to alert others, but also in order to garner 3 “Camp” points, which they would not get if they go out, or “Camp Out,” on their following turn.

The final playing feature, which can actually give the remaining players an edge over the winner of the round, is the choice of a final card draw, which they are not allowed to discard.

Final card hands are scored in various ways, depending on their makeup.

—description from the designer

Liberation is the TSWW Game covering the Western Allied liberation of Nazi occupied Europe.

Commencing in July of 1943, play to force Italy out of the war, and then stab into the “soft underbelly of Europe” or launch a hail mary assault in 1943 on the French Coast. Smash the Nazis in France and drive deep into Germany with a successful post Overlord breakout… Can you hang on long enough in the West to defeat the Western Allies and possibly free up enough firepower to save the Reich? Doubtful – but its the only hope for a Germany on the verge of collapse in 1944….

With 14 maps, and a minimum of 5600 counters (quite probably more – the RAF alone will be 2 sheets, as will the Royal Navy) over 20 sheets, Liberation finalises the first generation of TSWW Games in the West. Development is at an advanced stage, with only USAAF and USN OBs to be researched, along with the Repubblica Sociale Italiana which is already part researched.

Map art is at an advanced stage, relying as it does on the heavily revised mapping for Mare Nostrum, Barbarossa and Blitzkrieg II.  Art snippets will appear in due course in our Blog!

The various modules and scenarios will commence with small learning ones designed to ease your way into the TSWW system with minimal fuss, and will progress through smaller modules handling the invasion of Sicily (Operation Husky), the Gothic Line, and Anzio, then into France via Overlord and Neptune, Avalanche (the invasion of the South of France) finally concluding with the Wacht am Rhein and the final breakouts into the depths of Nazi Germany for the land aficionados out there, along with the strategic bombing campaign undertaken by the RAF and USAAF against the Reich for those of you who must fly everywhere!

Major campaigns will include Italy, North West Europe and of course the usual massive Grand Campaign module handling the entire Western Allied liberation of Europe.  
You too can be Patton or Montgomery on the one hand, or Von Rundsted or Kesselring on the other.

Space permitting Liberation will also include a major what if campaign designed to explore Winston Churchill’s desired approach to Germany… through the Ljubljana gap and into Southern Germany, heading off the Soviet advance from the East, and fulfilling the promise made by Chamberlain to defend Poland…

It’s time to PLAY outside the box with Office Decathlon - a series of Olympic-inspired physical and mental challenges where you can show the office who’s boss!

Choose from events like Office Chair Bobsled, Coffee Cup Relay or Pencil Javelin for team building, icebreakers and pure enjoyment!

Individual players or teams compete in 10 different events using everyday office supplies.  Each event is scored and the overall first, second and third place winners are draped in gold, silver and bronze medals in an award ceremony - creating podiums and playing patriotic background music is highly encouraged!

—description from the publisher

Kamikaze is the last TSWWV1 Series Title

With a minimum of 12 Counter sheets (and probably 16 – this is going to be a BIG game) and 20-22 map sheets (14-18 15 mile maps, 2-4 strategic maps) the game picks up the NPAC and CPAC campaigns right were Day of Infamy leaves off.

The campaign starts in November of 1943 with the initial landings on Makin and Tarawa, moving through the Marshall Islands to the Marianas and finally the invasion of Okinawa in 1945.

Additionally the game will include Operation Downfall – the proposed invasion of Japan which will presume that the A-Bomb programme was retained as a last resort (or was late)….

Clearly we will include various learning scenarios plus a variety of modules in the game covering the key elements of the long hard drive towards the Japanese home islands as well, plus some what if items as they are developed.

—description from the publisher

Antesignani is a miniature wargame ruleset for the Ancient-Medieval period.
It favors playability, reduction of litigious cases and adaptability to all types of basing, minis scales and play area.

Antesignani est une règle pour la période antique/médiévale privilégiant la jouabilité, la réduction a minima des situations litigieuses, et l’adaptabilité à tous types de soclage, d’échelles et de surface de jeu.

A fun- filled race and collect game featuring delightful colour puzzle pictures of those old Watch with mother favourites; The flowerpot men, Andy pandy, The woodentops and Rag Tag and Bobtail.

The game is simple yet fun to play and introduces colour, shape and number recognition to younger people.

—description from the back of the box

A gateway board game that expertly balances the simplicity of traditional platforms with lite deck building and co-operative strategy.

Randomly select a character & place your pawns. (Each character has a different ability with which to support the team during play.) Select the dungeon boss & place its pawn. (Unique bosses create dynamic gameplay & allow for great expansion opportunities!)

Begin the players round. Each player draws from the Discovery deck, resolves play cards, then rolls for their movement. Begin chase round. The bosses do not enter the dungeon until after their Delay. Once in play, bosses move based on their speed + abilities. Fallen allies seek vengeance. Any players who have fallen to peril will draw from the VENGEANCE DECK and will attack the active players! Repeat rounds until the game is complete and  you were able to run out of the dungeon.

The 2nd Edition will feature improved instructions, updated character tokens, an updated board, and each of our 211 cards are being rewritten to reduce unnecessary terms and provide players with an overall improved play ability across the board (no pun intended).

—description from the designer

Seacom is a game of naval conquest for 2 players, that combines elements of popular deckbuilding and dueling card games with a strong focus on balanced gameplay and heavy interaction. The winner is decided by reducing your opponent's supply points to 0. There are many ways to achieve this, but the path you choose is your own.

Down To Hell is a board game that faithfully reproduces popular hack and slash video games. It offers a wide variety of mechanics well known from other board games. The game can be played in cooperative mode, as well as in solo mode. In this game heroes fight against evil who have invaded their land.

There are four hero classes, each of them are distinguished by specific attacks, spells and other abilities. There are multiple ways to carry out the skills of your hero throughout the game. Specific skillsets can be more suitable for fighting against players or monsters, the choice is yours.

Fighting against a boss is about guessing the boss's next move and planning your next move accordingly. A player with the lowest priority token can see the next boss action card, which is a compensation for being attacked first. Each of the bosses has a unique set of skills, there is a big reward for each of them.

—description from the publisher

Braves Bataillons: règle Second Empire is a Regimental scale Miniature wargame ruleset for the French Second Empire from the Crimean War to the Franco-Prussian War. In French

For 10-28mm miniatures.

Braves Bataillons: règle Second Empire
Règle de jeu avec figurines pour le Second Empire, de la Crimée à la Guerre de 70

System allowing players to handle about 10 Brigade level units each, a force equivalent to an Army Corps.

This system is compatible with the use of hexagons maps.

Pax Viking is a historical strategy game of trade and diplomacy in the 10th century for 1-6 players. The game highlights those Vikings who travelled eastwards, towards the rich trade routes of Persia and around the Black Sea. Skilled opportunists in the matters of silver and axe, these Vikings are ready to wield whichever worked best in any given situation. They shared an adventurous explorer ethos with the westward travelling Vikings, and reached far to the south and east, forming strong alliances, influencing societies, and founding empires along their way.

The areas under Norse control are vast. The administration of power is becoming increasingly complicated. The Viking longships are excellent for travelling both at sea and on rivers. In the western part of Europe, your neighbour Jarls in Denmark and Norway are pillaging the lands. It is wise to be on good terms with these Powerful Allies. You interact with them by travelling to their Posts in the West. But you are also aware of the economic advantages to be gained by having followers in the strong Trade Center of some existing larger cities as well. It is up to you to weave and navigate a successful saga within Pax Viking in order to become the first Swedish monarch!

—description from the publisher

Find three matching words as quickly as possible for a category and two specific letters. But be careful: If your teammates have written down the same words, you will unfortunately have to delete them and you will not get any points!

—description from the designer

OMEGA is a strategic game, revisiting in an original way the theme of secret societies.
You play as an apprentice who is trying to join a mysterious organization known as OOTO. For this, you will have to summon the Ancient Spirits to discover the Arcana of the Omega. So, when the ritual ends, the Disciples will decide which apprentice is worthy to join them...

In a Game of OMEGA, you engage in an occult ritual at the end of which will
be designated the new Initiate of the brotherhood. You will summon Spirits with Runes. These Spirits will guide your progress on the Ritual disc in order to access the Arcana.
The first candidate to reach the number 7 Arcana will end the Ritual. Spirits, Runes and Arcana have special powers. You will have to learn to handle them and combine them to hope to be chosen.
There will be many strategies that can lead you to victory, but when you appear before the judges, be sure to have by your side powerful Arcana and, if possible, enough runes to best satisfy each of your Spirits...

A party game where you roast your friends.

BOOM! Roasted begins with each player drawing 7 cards from the top of the deck in the “Roasts” pile. The youngest player in the group assumes the role of the Honoree and gets the first verbal beating—take your medicine and shut up about it!

The remaining players serve as the Roasters for the round, while the Honoree draws a “Setups” card and reads the set-up aloud beginning with their own name, and ending with “Roast Me.” Each Roaster then chooses the “Roasts” card that best corresponds with the setup and hands it face-down to the Honoree, who then shuffles the responses.

After shuffling, the Honoree inserts their first name while re-reading aloud the “Setups” card in conjunction with each of the “Roasts” cards, and chooses the funniest or most clever combination. The Roaster responsible for the best burn must point their finger at the Honoree and say, “Boom! Roasted” and is awarded the Setups card, which counts as one point.

Twofers: On “Setups” card scenarios requiring two answers, place the “Roasts” card for your first answer on the bottom with the second answer on top so that it may be read by the Honoree in the order you intended.

Roasters will replace any card(s) used during the previous round; the Honoree from the previous round is now free to roast the shit out of the next person.

The person to the Honoree’s left is the next in-line to be trashed by their friends. The Roaster with the most “Setups” cards/points at the end of the game wins the coveted title of Roastmaster or Roastmistress.

This game is intended for entertainment purposes only. BOOM! Roasted is not responsible for any depression, lack of self-worth, wallowing pity, OR any therapist expenses incurred as a result of playing this game.

If you don’t know what a word in our instructions or deck of cards means, you must be the type of person who doesn’t know how to Google things.

Note: If you’re already an asshole before playing this game, our material is not intended to serve as a form of realistic hazing or degradation. In other words, don’t be a bullying dickhead to people in real life.

—description from the designer

Card game and strategy for 2 - 4 players from 8 years of age in which each player must complete their DREAM by creating a row of 6 cards with increasing numbers from 1 to 6, hindering opponents with the NIGHTMARE cards.
Can you complete your dream and make your opponents have nightmares?

OBJECTIVE OF GAME
Complete your Dream row by trying to obstruct your opponents with Nightmare cards.
The winner is the player who creates a row of 6 Dream cards, with an increasing numbering from 1 to 6, without holding any cards in hand.

SPECIAL CASES
When a player no longer holds any cards and there are no more cards on the deck, but in his row there are also Nightmare cards, the opponents can continue playing until they hold no cards in hand. The player with most Dream cards in his row wins.
In the event of a tie the winner is the one who has the most consecutive Dream cards in his row.

PREPARATION 
Shuffle the deck and deal out 4 cards to each player. The deck is then left in the centre of game area. The youngest player starts and the game proceeds clockwise.

PROCEDURE
During the game each player must choose between:
Taking one card from the deck and putting it in his hand 
Playing a card in his own row or in the row of an opponent
Players can hold up to 10 cards in hand.

—description from the publisher

Bodyguard is a card game in which a president, a bodyguard and  any number of assassins try to reach their goals over the course of several rounds. In each round, a different player plays the president.

The president wins by eliminating any assassin (or surviving by the end of the round).
The assassins win if they kill the president.
The bodyguard wins by rescuing the president.

The president deals the role cards to the other players, with one card remaining unassigned. Also, each player holds six hand cards. On a turn, a player can either play an action or a hit card. A player who has four different hit cards in front of them, is eliminated from the round (typically meaning the end of the round, unless the bodyguard is eliminated first). If the president receives the fourth hit card, the bodyguard can play three different hit cards to rescue the president. Afterwards, points are awarded and another round start, until each player has played the president once. Highest overall score wins the game.

Each player has an starting amount of 12 points and choses one of the available starting spaces. Movement is determined by a die.

If a player gets on a numbered space, he refers to the corresponding number near the border of the game board and follows the rules printed there. As a result he may lose or gain points.

If a player reaches an occupied space, he has to draw a trivia card About the history of Israel and answer the question printed there. If he answers correctly, he may advance 5 spaces. If he does'nt know the answer he has to go 10 spaces back and loses 10 points.

The first player to reach space 50 (Jerusalem) wins the game and is proclaimed major of Jerusalem. The player with the most points gets to be prime minister of Israel.

—user summary

A Elegia do Pássaro da Morte (The Elegy of the Bird of Death) is an eleven card microgame. 6 double-sided cards contain verses of a poem, 4 are identity cards, and the last one is the death card.

The verse cards are shuffled and laid out in a column, forming a poem. Each player receives a character card. The poem tells about the characters' death, and the goal of the game is to manipulate the poem and escape death 4 times.

Each character card shows four combinations of verse card symbols, one combinatino on each side. Whenever each of these appears in the poem, all turned to the red card side, the player has escaped once, and then they turn their character card by 90 degrees to achieve the next sequence.

On a turn, can do three actions: they may move one of the last two poem cards to the first position in the poem, or flip the first card of the poem to the other side (which results in certain other cards to be flipped as well), or escape death by having the three necessary cards flipped to the red side.

The first player to escape death four times is the winner - everybody else dies.

The game is based on the novel O Réquiem do Pássaro da Morte by Andrio Santos. Although the poem is in Portuguese, the game itself is language independent.

Join the Locke family and their friends as they explore landmarks in their new home of Lovecraft, MA. Find and use powerful keys, make powerful allies, and put together the pieces of the past. But beware - not everyone is who they appear to be! Demons may be hiding among the group, enacting their own devious plans. Shadow of Doubt is a race to root out the traitors before they can open the Black Door and unleash a horde of demons upon the world!

Based on the award-winning graphic novel Locke & Key by IDW Publishing, Shadow of Doubt is a light, snappy social deduction game that's dripping with theme.

—description from the publisher

This game is played with a standard 52 card deck, either solo as a simulation, or a two-player game where two teams compete against each other in a simulated cricket match.

A coin flip decides who bats or bowls first and play begins by drawing six cards. The aim is to play a card that's higher than your opponents.

If the bowler's card is higher,  a dot ball or a wicket happens. If the batter's card is higher, the batter scores that many runs or causes a wicket. Otherwise if tied, there is an automatic dot ball.

The innings ends after a predetermined amount of overs, or ten wickets, then the players change sides. Standard cricket scoring rules decide who wins. A standard cricket scoresheet can be used to score the game.

The card values are Ace to 4 scoring one run, 5 to 7 scoring two runs, 8 scoring three, 9 to 10 scoring a four, Jack and Queen scoring a six, and finally, a King being a wicket, no matter who plays it. You should shuffle after every 2 hands.

There is also a solo mode which just simulates a game, where you only play the batting side which has been tested to be reasonably accurate to 20/20 cricket if you shuffle after every 4 overs. The scoring for this is Ace to 3 scoring dots, 4-6 scoring one run, 7 & 8 scoring two runs, 9 scoring three runs, 10 and Jack scoring four runs, Queen scoring six runs, and King being a wicket.

I must note that other people have probably created similar rules, and I do not claim to have invented the game, merely designed this particular variant. I made a mockup of the solo game in 2007 using GameMaker 7 and distributed that version amongst friends and family, and this ruleset is based on an evolution of said mockup.

—description from the designer

Lost in Valhalla is a survival card game with fighting, crafting and scavenging. You play as a modern soul accidentally sent to an ancient afterlife - Valhalla.

Be the first player to escape Valhalla by finding resurrection runes - all while scavenging for supplies and fighting off dangerous foes with mighty weapons!


     Players choose who goes first - we suggest the youngest player. 
     Make sure there are 3 Resurrection Runes per player placed in the explore deck.
     After shuffling each deck seperately, Arrange the 3 decks (Explore, Scavenge, Items) face down on the table in a line next to each other.


The selected Player One goes first and remaining Players take turns in a clockwise direction. On your turn you can pick up 2 cards from the top of any deck. (Explore, scavenge, items). You are allowed to pickup any deck of your choice, for example, 1 'Explore' card and 1 'Item' card based on what you need.

The aim of the game is to make your way through the 'Explore' deck and find 3 Resurrection runes that are hidden in the deck. The first player to do so wins the game.
Once you receive foe cards over -4 hit points*, you cannot advance any further in the 'Explore' deck. You must then craft items picked up from the 'Item' deck, to remove foe cards, using scavenged materials from the 'Scavenge' deck. 
There are also helpful cards scattered throughout each deck that are free to use once found. These are discarded once used.

Dr. Smile is a one card microgame. The card shows eight facial expressions. One player plays the role of the evil Dr. Smile, who has locked up the players in metal cylinders so the only thing they can move is their faces. Dr. Smile secretly defines a sequence of three such expressions (or more, for a more challenging game).

Players stand in a a row in front of Dr. Smile and take turns making one of the expressions, with Dr. Smile moving his/her head when it is correct. From the second round onward, the second expression must also be guessed, and so on. The goal is to find out the complete sequence in order to escape from the evil doctor.

Content: 36 picture cards, 2 dice

The picture cards have the shape of a sitting cat. On the back is a dice symbol with 1 to 6 die pips. The front shows one or more cats. Some cards show a bag or food or another motif.

At the begin of the game all cards are ordered by their dice symbol and each pile is shuffled. Then the players roll dice for to receive the top card of the corresponding pile until all cards are distributed. If a player rolls a die symbol, which does not have any cards left, they do not receive any card.

As soon all cards are distributed, the players turn their cards over. Each player needs a bag of food to feed their cats. If a player has no food they have to trade their card with the most cats with another player to receive a bag of food. The player with the cat king requires an additional bag of food. The player with the most cats wins the game. The cat king scores 7 points.

Each player takes up the role of a colorbug: Frida Kohlor, Vincent van Bugh, Salvabug Dalí or Pabug Picasso. They get a screen behing which they hide their objectives.

Primary color and picture tiles are shuffled and laid out face-down in a grid. Players take turns and can either
- flip open a tile
- put a ladybug token on an open tile
- mix two colors. For that, they point at two color open tiles without ladybugs and discard one of their objectives. The objectives are secondary and tertiary colors, and they can only be discarded if two colors needed to mix them are visible in the grid.
To claim a picture tile, players have to have their ladybug tokens on color tiles which are necessary for painting the picture.

The first player who gets rid of their three objective tiles and has placed three pictures in their gallery is the winner.

Broken is a card game for 1-5 players. In the game you slip into the role of a publisher who sells board games on Kickstarter, and if possible does not deliver them. The golden rule is: having money comes from keeping money. So you play your cards in a way that buy the most profitable games possible and do not have to produce them. But be careful, because the other players have the same goal.

During the game, players take turns to play an excuse card that matches the card that is on top of the discard pile. The closer their card matches, the more money they get. Players can play sets of the same excuse to get greater rewards.

Quero-quero (Gimme-gimme) is a card game developed for small children, starting at 3 years old. The deck consists of 36 cards representing six Brazilian endangered animal species in six different colours with one to six animals per card.  As cards are displayed on the table, children need to associate cards by animal, colour or quantity in order to take as many cards as possible. When the deck runs out, the child with the biggest card collection wins the match. It is important that the child announce his/her move saying "gimme-gimme the panther", to take all panther cards; "gimme-gimme the blues", to take all blue cards; or "gimme-gimme the fours" to take all cards with four animals.
As the child grows, new rules add complexity to the game, making it more tactical, as the child receives objective cards. In that case, cards matching the objectives will give him/her extra points.

—description from the publisher

This game is made for marching band students and directors.

Deal all players seven white answer cards. The player with the biggest ego goes first. While this is almost certainly the trumpet player, they are referred to as "The Judge." The Judge draws a blue question card and reads it to the other players. Players select the card in their hand that best answers the question. Cards are played face down and shuffled. The Judge reviews all the cards and selects the winner who holds onto the blue card for the remainder of the game.

Includes: 396 high-quailty cards in a rigid two-piece box.
Each set contains 6 blank answer cards to write your own smartass responses.

—description from the publisher

NOTE: Although the publisher says 12+ for this game, there are a handful of mature innuendo cards that may be removed for younger audiences.

Life in the forest is a lot of fun, at least while the sun is shining and the leaves are on the trees. Those days don’t last forever though, and long before the weather starts to change, the wise animals start to harvest for the long cold winter ahead. You will spend many months tucked into your burrow and you want to make it as cozy as possible. A nice bowl of soup, a comfortable rocking chair, and some toys and games will go a long way to make those dark winter days pass by quickly.

In Creature Comforts, you spend the Spring, Summer, and Fall gathering different goods from the forest and spending them to collect items that will make your home more inviting while the world outside is covered in a layer of snow. Each round you send family members out to various locations in an attempt to gain supplies. If they fall short of their goal, they’ll learn a lesson and be better prepared next time. The family that has created the most comfortable den wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Get smart with Newton in this super fun game of balance and skill! Build newton’s tree by adding branches and keep it balanced as you add and pluck apples and move Newton around. Strategize and play your game cards wisely! Are you going to be the one to fumble? Remember…To the tree, quicker the tumble!

—description from the back of the box

Good Guess is the perfect casual party game for friends and families, for teams and individuals. It’s part riddle, part trivia and part just sound logical reasoning.

We love this trivia game because it stimulates more conversation than (dare we say) any game ever!

Clues come one at a time - the first team to guess correctly earns points. Use wild cards to pull a fast one on a leader who thinks they’re cruising to victory. With for ways to play ranging from fast-paced to highly collaborative, it’s a great addition to any dinner party, getaway, family evening or long car ride.

Our family created this game over 10 years ago after we couldn’t find a simple, fun and stimulating game to play in the evenings. We love it because it stimulates conversation, stories and all sorts of goodness that contributes rather than detracts from a great evening. We intentionally made the game play simple. We eliminated the need for game pieces, a game board, die and, of course, complicated instructions that bewilder and frustrate.

The clue cards are loaded with astonishing facts about everyday people, places and things that are certain to entertain. Our rule of thumb was: the clues needed to make the folks playing the game excited about guessing and learning the answer. Did you know, for example, that Harry Houdini died one week after being buried alive?

Ancient Wargames Rules
      
Designed to cover the rise and fall of the Roman empire. These rules are especially suited to refights of historical battles. No, you don't have to rebase your figures. Yes, they play as fast as DBM. No, you won't have to buy new army list books, in fact you can use the armies you use for other rules. Included are morale rules so that bad troops run away, good troops hang around a bit longer. General figures don't fight but have command and combat ratings to inspire the troops that do. The rules are designed to encourage historical tactics.

—description from the publisher

The trick-taking game ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ”ã‚¸ã‚¹ã‚¿ (Trapezista) was one of the finalists in the 2017 Trick Taking Party design competition in Japan.

In the game, players take on the role of trapeze artists and try not to fall or drop the other players. The game uses a subset of a standard deck of playing cards, including two jokers, and a board. The game is a standard "must follow" trick taking game, that incentivizes which players you win tricks before and after.

After four rounds, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Recycling is very important! In this game players roll dice and move their pawns around the city. During their movement they come across different kinds of litter which they have to put in the according recyling bin in order to be the first one to entirely fill up their own bins and win the game!

GoGetFish is the fishing game for 2-4 players.

GAME OBJECTIVE
Each player assumes the role of a skillful fisherman, who came from around the world to compete for the championship in fishing. Whenever your turn comes up, you may move your ship and select one of the following 4 action options:

     Fishing
     Collect treasure chest
     Docking
     Pass


The first player who was able to acquire 12 trophy points or the player who collected all of the 3 Artifacts will be the winner.

—description from the designer

Because as awesome as choir is, it's also kind of horrible.

Bass notes you can only hit during allergy season. Illegal photocopies of music. Singing with so much phlegm your throat is like a flute filled with gravy. Celebrate all the things that make choir special in this hilarious and snarky card game for die-hard choir geeks! Designed to be high school appropriate, your students will stay in the choir room to play this game, instead of doing drugs. It's that good, and you might save a life.

—description from the publisher

Ok theater kids...we heard you. A smelly costume. Unblended make up. Being tricked into naming the Scottish play. So many things about the thing we love are terrible things. So hey, why not play cards?


     396 cards
     high school appropriate
     Ages 14+
     Perfect for classrooms, cast parties, tech rehearsals, and any time you should be working on lines.


—description from the publisher

Mega City a Moloch of a city was flashy, loud and dirty. Life was hard and survival was complicated. If you knew the right people in Mega City it was easier. If you did what you were told, it was also easy. But the easiest way was to simply not stand out, become invisible, merge with the haze of the city and stay out of everything. What do I care? That’s the way it is. Many of the young people didn't mind, they were just interested in having fun, being cool and being able to do what they wanted to do. Why should one then interfere with the stress that the old people made for themselves. Until, yes, until you faced reality, staring at you brutally and cruelly, punching you in the face, breaking your bones or snuffing out your lights. 
That reality was a man whom everybody only referred to as ”The Baron”, the crime lord who controlled everything in Mega City. His army of henchmen was everywhere and enforced his will with unlimited brutality and cruelty. 
In Secret Hunters, each player leads a group of young people who have formed a gang with the goal of overthrowing The Baron. They all share the fate of having been brutally abused by The Baron and his henchmen. To achieve their goal are not choosy with their methods. They hack terminals, crack safes, bribe the followers of the mystery man, but they would never use weapons. Each gang consists of 4 specialists. A hacker, a safecracker, a spy and a biker. Using the action board and 4 action tokens, the characters are guided through Mega City, but, The Baron does not just watch as his weaknesses uncovered, his henchmen strike mercilessly. Four pieces of evidence need to be found and presented to the court in order to take out The Baron, but to find out which four pieces of evidence they are, the players need to collect clues they get from informants, as to where relevant safes and terminals are located which may contain possible evidence. The gang which has collected all four pieces of evidence and manages to take them to court wins the game and is referred to by the others as the real Secret Hunters.

—description from the designer

Miniature wargame rules for 1/300 scale figures.
